CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 22, 1941, pg. 9, reads: "Had Good Time on Visit - Lovely Lena Horne spent a few days in Pittsburgh last week. When guest at the smart Synchronettes Valentine party Friday evening, Photographer Harris snapped this charming photo.  She left for Washington Saturday to join Charlie Barnett's orchestra.  While in city she was guest of her dad, Ted Horne."Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, February 7, 1942, pg. 9, reads: Likes Sea Food - Pretty Lena Horne, of stage and screen, likes sea food.  Bess has created a recipe in her honor...Lena Crab Meat Salad."Cutline for image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 10, 1945, pg. 8, reads: "Highlights in a Brilliant Career of journalism that outlined the name of Julia Bumry Jones in incandescents that could be seen throughout the reading nation, were these moments chosen above from among the many such in her twenty-five years as women's editor of The Courier.  Jule, affectionately known as Talk O' Town, after her weekly column that made history, is shown above with Lena Horne, the beautiful young singer whose success story was developed so capably by the dean of women journalists... - Courier Photos by Harris."
TitMainTitle: Pittsburgh Courier columnist Julia Bumry Jones and Lena Horne posed with arms around each other, in club
